Package org.thewhitemage13.handler

Class UserDeletedEventHandlerImpl

java.lang.Object
org.thewhitemage13.handler.UserDeletedEventHandlerImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.thewhitemage13.interfaces.UserDeletedEventHandlerInterface
@Component @KafkaListener(topics="user.deleted") public class UserDeletedEventHandlerImpl extends Object implements org.thewhitemage13.interfaces.UserDeletedEventHandlerInterface
Handles events related to user deletions in the system.

This class listens to the Kafka topic "user.deleted" and processes user deletion events. Upon receiving a user deletion event, it calls the MediaServiceImpl service to delete all media associated with the deleted user.

Key Features:

  • Listens to the Kafka topic "user.deleted" for user deletion events.
  • Invokes the MediaServiceImpl.deleteAllByUserId(Long) method to delete all media associated with the deleted user.
  • Handles MediaNotFoundException if an issue arises during media deletion.
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Mukhammed Lolo

  • Constructor Details

    • UserDeletedEventHandlerImpl

      @Autowired public UserDeletedEventHandlerImpl(MediaServiceImpl mediaServiceImpl)
      Constructs a new UserDeletedEventHandlerImpl with the specified MediaServiceImpl.

      The constructor injects the MediaServiceImpl service, which is responsible for managing media-related operations such as deleting media for a specific user.

      Parameters:
      mediaServiceImpl - the service used to manage media operations

  • Method Details

    • userDeleted

      @KafkaHandler public void userDeleted(org.thewhitemage13.UserEvent userEvent) throws MediaNotFoundException
      Handles a user deletion event and deletes all media associated with the deleted user.

      When a UserEvent for a deleted user is received, this method calls the MediaServiceImpl.deleteAllByUserId(Long) method to remove all media related to that user. If no media are found or an error occurs during the process, a MediaNotFoundException is thrown.

      Specified by:
      userDeleted in interface org.thewhitemage13.interfaces.UserDeletedEventHandlerInterface
      Parameters:
      userEvent - the event containing the deleted user's information
      Throws:
      MediaNotFoundException - if an error occurs while deleting media associated with the user
